intro: Calamistrum minutum, commonly known as the small calamistrum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in fine hairs, giving it a delicate appearance. It is often found in temperate regions and is noted for its subtle fragrance.
